Properties.Octopus.Action.Script.ScriptBody:
# Load IIS module:
Import-Module WebAdministration

# Get AppPool Name
$appPoolName = $OctopusParameters['appPoolName']
# Get the number of retries
$retries = $OctopusParameters['appPoolCheckRetries']
# Get the number of attempts
$delay = $OctopusParameters['appPoolCheckDelay']

# Stop App Pool if not already stopped
if ((Get-WebAppPoolState($appPoolName)).Value -ne "Stopped"){
    Write-Output "Stopping IIS app pool $appPoolName"
    Stop-WebAppPool $appPoolName

    $state = Get-WebAppPoolState $appPoolName
    $counter = 1
    
    # Wait for the app pool to the "Stopped" before proceeding
    do{ 
        $status = (Get-WebAppPoolState $appPoolName).Value
        Write-Output "$counter/$retries Waiting for IIS app pool $appPoolName to shut down completely. Current status: $status"
        $counter++
        Start-Sleep -Milliseconds $delay
    }
    while($state.Value -ne 'Stopped' -and $counter -le $retries)  
    
    # Throw an error if the app pool is not stopped
    if($counter -ge $retries) { 
        throw "Could not shut down IIS app pool $appPoolName. `nTry to increase the number of retries ($retries) or delay between attempts ($delay milliseconds)." }
}

Parameters.Name: AppPoolName
Parameters.Label: Application pool name
Parameters.HelpText: The name of the application pool in IIS.

Parameters.Name: AppPoolCheckDelay
Parameters.Label: Status check interval
Parameters.HelpText: The delay, in milliseconds,  between each attemt to query the application pool to see if its status is "Stopped"

Parameters.Name: AppPoolCheckRetries
Parameters.Label: Status check retries
Parameters.HelpText: The number of retries before an error is thrown.
